answers.answer: not being funny you could  be constipated, I say this because I have a incisional hernia on left side and id if if i press underneath it hurts, and before I go it hurts like mad.The other thing i had was a cyst behind my pancreas that started minor ache then I was on morphine in in Hospital.  I would go along and chat to your GP if like me you have no faith take a book and go down to your A@e CENTRE,or local medical drop in centre, but get it checked out pleasequirky Turtle

question: Hi,  I'm a 32 yr male who is moderately over weight.   I don't have diabetes or anything like that.     I started one day having this aching feeling over on the far side of my abdomen, maybe 3-5 inches below my right rib cage.   At first I wondered if I have a gall stone or something, but then I wondered if it was too low......then I realized that pressing around on the area doesn't cause extra pain, but breathing in past a certain point increases the pain feeling.   I would say it's a mild to moderate pain, not severe, but it's not normal...so the question would be does it seem like an organ or simply muscular or something like that?So in other words, it doesn't hurt more if you just press down, but if I breath in on my own, or particularly against your hand it would hurt more
title: Pain in abdomen, but mainly when breathing in..help?
